content: <metadata xml:lang="en"><Esri><CreaDate>20141121</CreaDate><CreaTime>07004200</CreaTime><ArcGISFormat>1.0</ArcGISFormat><ArcGISstyle>ISO 19139 Metadata Implementation Specification GML3.2</ArcGISstyle><SyncOnce>TRUE</SyncOnce><ModDate>20141121</ModDate><ModTime>9170000</ModTime><scaleRange><minScale>150000000</minScale><maxScale>5000</maxScale></scaleRange><ArcGISProfile>ISO19139</ArcGISProfile><DataProperties><itemProps><imsContentType export="False" /></itemProps></DataProperties></Esri><dataIdInfo><idPurp>The CADNSDI or the Cadastral Publication Data Standard is the cadastral data component of the NSDI. This is the publication guideline for cadastral data that is intended to provide a common format and structure and content for cadastral information that can be made available across jurisdictional boundaries, providing a consistent and uniform cadastral data to meet business need that includes connections to the source information from the data stewards. The data stewards determine which data are published and should be contacted for any questions on data content or for additional information. The cadastral publication data is data provided by cadastral data producers in a standard form on a regular basis. Cadastral publication data has two primary components, land parcel data and cadastral reference data. It is important to recognize that the publication data are not the same as the operation and maintenance or production data. The production data is structured to optimize maintenance processes, is integrated with internal agency operations and contains much more detail than the publication data. The publication data is a subset of the more complete production data and is reformatted to meet a national standard so data can be integrated across jurisdictional boundaries and be presented in a consistent and standard form nationally.  This data set represents the GIS Version of the Public Land Survey System including both rectangular and non-rectangular surveys. The metadata describes the lineage, sources and production methods for the data content. The definitions and structure of this data is compliant with FGDC Cadastral Data Content Standards and Guidelines for publication.   This data set is optimized for data publication and sharing rather than for specific "production" or operation and maintenance. This data set includes the following: PLSS Fully Intersected (all of the PLSS feature at the atomic or smallest polygon level), PLSS Townships, First Divisions and Second Divisions (the hierarchical break down of the PLSS Rectangular surveys) PLSS Special surveys (non rectangular components of the PLSS) Meandered Water, Corners and Conflicted Areas (known areas of gaps or overlaps between Townships or state boundaries). The Entity-Attribute section of this metadata describes these components in greater detail.</idPurp><idCredit>Premier Data, BLM Cadastral Survey, BLM National Operations Center, FGDC Cadastral Subcommittee</idCredit><idCitation xmlns=""><resTitle>Cadastral National Spatial Data Infrastructure (CadNSDI) for Idaho</resTitle><date><pubDate>2014-11-21T00:00:00</pubDate></date><citRespParty xmlns=""><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="010" /></role></citRespParty></idCitation><dataExt xmlns=""><geoEle xmlns=""><GeoBndBox><westBL>-126.118904</westBL><eastBL>-99.542849</eastBL><southBL>30.882672</southBL><northBL>49.430357</northBL><exTypeCode>1</exTypeCode></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><searchKeys><keyword>Cadastral National Spatial Data Infrastructure</keyword><keyword>CadNSDI</keyword><keyword>Public Land Survey System</keyword><keyword>PLSS</keyword><keyword>township</keyword><keyword>section</keyword></searchKeys><dataLang><languageCode value="eng" /></dataLang><dataChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></dataChar><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>The CADNSDI or the Cadastral Publication Data Standard is the cadastral data component of the NSDI. This is the publication guideline for cadastral data that is intended to provide a common format and structure and content for cadastral information that can be made available across jurisdictional boundaries, providing a consistent and uniform cadastral data to meet business need that includes connections to the source information from the data stewards. The data stewards determine which data are published and should be contacted for any questions on data content or for additional information. The cadastral publication data is data provided by cadastral data producers in a standard form on a regular basis. Cadastral publication data has two primary components, land parcel data and cadastral reference data. It is important to recognize that the publication data are not the same as the operation and maintenance or production data. The production data is structured to optimize maintenance processes, is integrated with internal agency operations and contains much more detail than the publication data. The publication data is a subset of the more complete production data and is reformatted to meet a national standard so data can be integrated across jurisdictional boundaries and be presented in a consistent and standard form nationally.</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="015" /></tpCat></dataIdInfo><mdHrLv><ScopeCd value="005" /></mdHrLv><mdLang><languageCode value="eng" /></mdLang><mdChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></mdChar><mdDateSt>20141121</mdDateSt><mdContact xmlns=""><rpIndName>John Courtright</rpIndName><rpOrgName>Bureau of Land Management Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="002" /></role><rpCntInfo xmlns=""><cntAddress addressType=""><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709</postCode><eMailAdd>john_courtright@blm.gov</eMailAdd></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3966</voiceNum></cntPhone></rpCntInfo></mdContact><distInfo xmlns=""><distFormat xmlns=""><formatName Sync="FALSE">File Geodatabase</formatName><formatVer>10.2</formatVer></distFormat><distTranOps xmlns=""><transSize Sync="TRUE">1.866</transSize></distTranOps><distributor xmlns=""><distorCont xmlns=""><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="005" /></role><rpCntInfo xmlns=""><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 S. GVinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>US</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-4000</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum tddtty="">(208) 373-3967</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45am - 4:15pm, Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></distorCont><distorTran xmlns=""><onLineSrc xmlns=""><linkage>http://cloud.insideidaho.org/webApps/util/zip.ashx?fn=http://cloud.insideidaho.org/data/blm/blm-nsdi-2014</linkage><orDesc>Download File Geodatabase</orDesc></onLineSrc></distorTran></distributor></distInfo></metadata>
